List of years in Germany

Events in the year 1946 in Germany.

Contents

  • 1 Events
  • 2 Births
  • 3 Deaths
  • 4 References

Events[edit]

  • Merger of the KPD and SPD into the Socialist Unity Party of Germany.
  • February 21 - German newspaper Die Zeit was founded.
  • April 2 - German newspaer Die Welt was founded.
  • Date unknown: German company Axel Springer SE was founded.

Births[edit]

  • January 19 - Reinhard Lakomy, German song-writer, composer (died 2013)
  • February 23 — Bodo Hauser, German journalist and writer (died 2004)
  • January 31 - Wolfgang Stumph, German actor
  • February 26 - Jaecki Schwarz, German actor
  • March 1 - Jacky Dreksler, German television producer
  • March 24 - Klaus Dinger, German musician (died 2008)
  • April 6 - Wolfgang Ischinger, German diplomat
  • April 17 — Georges J. F. Köhler, German biologist (died 1995)
  • May 9 — Drafi Deutscher, German singer (died 2006)
  • May 14 — Elmar Brok, German politician
  • May 15 - Klaus-Peter Siegloch, German journalist
  • May 17 — Udo Lindenberg, German singer
  • March 31 - Klaus Wolfermann, German javelin thrower
  • April 20 - Sabine Bergmann-Pohl, German politician
  • June 26 — Maria von Welser, German journalist
  • July 1:
    • Stefan Aust, German journalist
    • Rosalie Abella, German jurist
  • July 15 - Achim Mentzel, German actor (died 2016)
  • July 26 - Erwin Huber, German politician
  • July 26 - Wolfgang Schneiderhan|, German genereal of the Bundeswehr
  • July 29 - Enoch zu Guttenberg, German conductor (died 2018)
  • August 20 — Henryk Broder, German journalist
  • August 20 - Ralf Hütter, German musician
  • September 29 - Monika Harms, German lawyer
  • November 15 - Michael, Prince of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach, German nobleman
  • December 14 — Ruth Fuchs, German athlete
  • December 22 - Robert van Ackeren, German film director and writer
  • December 30 — Berti Vogts, German football player

Deaths[edit]

  • February 1 - Hans Bethge, German poet (born 1876)
  • February 8 - Felix Hoffmann, German chemist (born 1868)
  • February 10 - Eduard Fresenius, German entrepreneur (born 1874)
  • February 24 - Alfred Henke, German politician (born 1868)
  • March 14 - Werner von Blomberg, German Minister of War, and Commander-in-Chief of the German Armed Forces (born 1878)
  • March 22 - Clemens August Graf von Galen, German cardinal of Roman-Catholic Church (born 1878)
  • March 24 - Carl Schuhmann, German gymnast (born 1869)
  • May 16 - Bruno Tesch, German chemist and entrepreneur (born 1890)
  • June 6 - Gerhart Hauptmann, German dramatist (born 1862)
  • June 19 - Theodor Wulf, German physicist (born 1868)
  • August 5 - Wilhelm Marx, German politician (born 1863)
  • September 6 - Alfred Körte, German philologist (born 1866)
  • September 25 — Heinrich George, German actor (born 1893)
  • October 15 — Hermann Göring, World War I fighter ace and Reichsmarshall of Nazi Germany (born 1893)
  • October 16 - Alfred Jodl, German general (born 1890)
  • October 16 — Alfred Rosenberg, Nazi ideologue (born 1893)
  • October 16 - Wilhelm Keitel, German field marshal (born 1882)
  • October 16 - Arthur Seyss-Inquart, German politician (born 1892)
  • October 16 - Joachim von Ribbentrop, German politician (born 1893)
  • October 16 - Wilhelm Frick, German politician (born 1877)
  • October 26 - Otto Georg Thierack, German politician and jurist (born 1889)
  • November 18 - Georg Gradnauer, German politician (born 1866)
  • November 29 - Arthur Crispien, German politician (born 1875)
  • November 30 - Gustav Noske, German politician (born 1868)
  • December 29 - Georg Thomas, German general (born 1890)
